bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Thomas Mallon, born 2 Nov 1951, is an American novelist, New York Times literary critic, professor and former deputy chariman of the National Endowment for the Humanities. Mallon received his B.A. from Brown University and his M.A. and PhD from Harvard University. His works include A Book of One's Own: People and Their Diaries and Arts and Sciences: A Seventies Seduction. Mallon was an Associate Professor at Vassar from 1979-1991. He lives in, and frequently writes about, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Thomas Mallon Papers contain correspondence between Mary McCarthy and Mallon, dated 1973-1988. Additionally, the collection contains manuscripts for speeches and articles written during his tenure at Vassar.

separatedmaterial.p: Three boxes were separated from this collection and transferred to the Brown University Library, 1999. These materials include manuscripts, typescripts and related materials for Edmund Blunden, A Book of One's Own and Arts and Sciences.
